Name: Absinthe Drip Cocktail (Czech method)
Instructions:
BEWARE: please take care. Flames and alcohol are a dangerous combination!.
Place a sugar cube on a slotted absinthe spoon resting across the top of the glass. POUR the absinthe over the sugar cube into the glass. Light the absinthe-soaked cube and leave it to burn and caramelise. Using a bottle of chilled mineral water with a small hole in the cap, DRIP water over what's left of the sugar so it dissolves and drips into the glass. Add ice, stir, and serve.
Review: More about the theatrics involved in its making than the taste of the finished drink.
History: This supposedly bohemian method of serving absinthe became popular back in 1998 with the UK launch of Hill's Absinthe . Accordingly, if you are going to make this drink, then it is best to use a Czech-style absinthe such as La Fée Bohemian .
